{"step_by_step_thinking": "In the fasting state, when glucose levels are low, RBCs rely on alternative fuel sources for energy. One of the main fuel sources for RBCs in the fasting state is ketone bodies. Ketone bodies are produced from fatty acids in the liver during periods of prolonged fasting or low carbohydrate intake. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Ketone body.", "answer_choice": "C"}
